comment.author: 95856510@N00
comment._content: Google translation of "Du Doch Nicht" is "You Are Not Yet."

comment.author: 79371310@N02
comment._content: the sense is more like "was not meant for you!!" or "not you again!!" or "Not you!!" - When you can read that, you speak German, so you won't shoot at him (to prevent friendly fire). When you are flying behind a double decker, you can not read any national emblem (if existent at that time). When you are close enough to read it and you understand it, you shouldn't pull the trigger. Nowadays airplanes most fight beyond visual range but in WW1 they where so close.
